questions.question_text: You are about to use a hotel's guest wireless services using a wireless laptop. Which three items do you need to establish a wireless connection? (Choose three.)
questions.answer_description: Another common authentication method, especially for guest networks (for example, in hotels, where Internet access must be simple, requiring only an SSID with decent RF signal in each room and a web page to authenticate the user, regardless of the underlying operating system), is Web authentication.

questions.question_text:
A customer wants to deploy Cisco Cloud Wireless architecture with 802.11ac capabilities. Which two access points would meet the customers requirements?
(Choose two.)

choices.C: The most common deployment is three non-overlapping channels that are 20 MHz wide
choices.F: The most common deployment is three non-overlapping channels that are 22 MHz wide
choices.A: Defined DSSS and FHSS as possible methods for modulation
choices.H: The protocol sets the maximum throughput at1 Mb/s
choices.D: The protocol sets the maximum throughput at 1 Mb/s or 2 Mb/s
choices.B: Designed to operate in the 5 GHz ISM frequency spectrum
choices.G: Designed to operate in the2.4 GHz ISM frequency spectrum
choices.E: Defined FHSS and OFDM as possible methods for modulation

discussion.content:
I agree with Romail.
OFDM uses 20mhz channels, but was not adopted until 802.11a.
DSSS is the most common implementation of the original 802/11 (1997) protocol, which uses 22mhz channels.

questions.question_text: Which four options are the characteristics of the original 802.11 protocol? (Choose four.)
questions.answer_description:
FHSS is still described in the original 802.11 protocol, but another technique was preferred and adopted by all 802.11 networks: Direct Sequence Spread
Spectrum. Instead of small channels and a jumping sequence, the information is sent over a wider channel. This channel is 22 MHz wide (if the center frequency is
2.412, this channel spans from 2.401 GHz to 2.423 GHz) and does not move (no hopping, which is why the sequence is said to be direct instead of hopping).
Then, over this 22 MHz channel, several bits of information are sent in parallel. If a source of interference affects part of the channel, it will prevent only the bits sent in that frequency from reaching the receiver.

discussion.content: They would like to leverage 802.11ac enhanced speeds on the trusted employee WLAN, just open

A is wrong, because WPA2 with TKIP does not exist. WPA2 uses AES encryption.
B is wrong because WPA does not use AES
-> Can only be C

questions.question_text: A customer has completed the installation of an 802.11ac greenfield deployment at their corporate headquarters. They would like to leverage 802.11ac enhanced speeds on the trusted employee WLAN. In order to configure the employee WLAN, what Layer 2 security policies are valid?

discussion.content: Service port will allow GUI access where Console port will allow CLI access

questions.question_text: A customer cannot access the GUI on the Cisco 5508 Wireless Controller from the management interface due to network failure. Which interface can the customer use to access the WLC GUI until the network issues are resolved?
